intro: Psychotria triceps, commonly known as the three-veined psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of mostly flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, with three distinct leaflets that are often opposite in arrangement. Its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, typically displaying white or pale pink petals. Psychotria triceps is often found in shaded, moist environments such as rainforests and undergrowth.
